who.title: Who we are
who.description: We are an independent team coming from the UbiCOMP Student Research Club, primarily interested in Human-Computer Interaction. Within our group, we have ambitious and talented people working in the fields of User Experience, Software Development, 3D Modeling, and Electronics.

what.title: What we do
what.description: We are passionate about developing new technologies to serve other people. Our solutions are based on scientific research and the latest discoveries presented at international HCI conferences. When working on projects, we focus on usability and user experience.

how.title: About the project
how.description: The problem that inspired the project was the lack of adherence to medication recommendations by patients. With the onset of the pandemic, our daily tasks went into remote mode. Phone consultations replaced visits to the clinics and caregivers became unable to freely assess the health status of their patients. We designed a device and an app to facilitate remote monitoring of treatments and regular medication intake. As the project developed, more people joined us, bringing new knowledge and experience. Currently, the team consists of more than 13 members and is constantly growing.
